intro: Mammillaria yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a dense covering of white, woolly spines. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10 centimeters and has a compact, rounded shape. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, appearing in the axils of the areoles. Mammillaria yucatanensis is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
